content: slip it head wrap i designed this head wrap to go with the slip it wristlet pattern by tracie hinds i didn t have enough yarn for a hat so i thought this head wrap would be enough to keep the ears warm and not mess with the hair thank you tracie hinds for the inspiration and thank you to all of the ravel-ers who share their patterns i hope to give back by sharing this one the pattern is very straightforward with a k2p2 rib and the slip it 4-row pattern in the middle if you have comments or questions you can email me at denfemme@gmail com and i ll try to respond finished size about 8 ½ wide by 4 tall laid flat yarn madelintosh tosh dk in hollyhock 100% superwash merino wool 225yards/206 meters i used about a quarter of the skein using left over yarn after making the slip it wristlets needles us #7 circular needle 16 or 24 tapestry needle gauge 5 sts and 8 row in stockinette stitch = 1 inch page 1 of 2 abbreviations pm = place marker sm = slip marker wyif = with yarn in front purl-wise instructions slip it pattern round 1 knit round 2 purl 1 slip 1 wyif repeat across round 3 knit round 4 slip 1 wyif purl 1 repeat across begin co 108 sts join in the round i like to use the invisible join technique noted below co 1 extra st line up needles to join slip 1 st from left needle to right needle on right needle slip 2nd extra st over 1st st slip original st from right needle back to left needle using co working yarn and tail tighten down the stitch so that it disappears begin row 1 pm to indicate row change sm with each new row row 1 7 k2 p2 ribbing you should have about 1 row 8+ begin 4-row slip it pattern continue until you have about 3 from co edge finish with a k row round 1 or 3 last 7 row k2 p2 ribbing for 7 row you should have about 1 ribbing and about 4 overall bind off by knitting the ks and purling the ps weave in loose ends footnote if you like this slip it pattern check out the slip it wristlets by tracie hinds and the honey cowl by ann maria on
